Key Match Events: KL Rahul pulled off a direct hit from midwicket to get rid of Liton Das, who was batting on 60 at a strike-rate in excess of 200.
Post-Match Reflections: KL Rahul's direct hit from midwicket was the turning point of the match, leading to Bangladesh's loss by five runs.
MS Dhoni's run-out of Mushfiqur Rahim in a previous T20 World Cup match also played a crucial role in India's victory.
Both games turned out to be cliffhangers, leaving Bangladesh fans disappointed, aggrieved, and dejected.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Taskin Ahmed bowled at an economy rate of 3.75.
Liton Das scored 60 runs off 27 balls for the Tigers.
Bangladesh needed 85 off nine overs after the rain break.
With two runs needed off three balls, Mushfiqur Rahim was celebrating a potential historic win for the Tigers.
